intro: Priestleya longifolia, commonly known as the long-leaved priestleya, is a species of flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its slender, grass-like foliage and delicate, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its elongated leaves and showy inflorescences make it a distinctive and ornamental species. Priestleya longifolia is also valued for its ecological role in supporting local pollinators.
